node.title: How migration fraud works and ways to avoid visa scams in Australia
node.alt: An Australia visa stamp with the word SCAM written across it in red
node.description: Linh* was desperate when she handed over $110,000 to a self-proclaimed migration agent, her case is now under police investigation.
node.content:
["Linh (not her real name)\u00a0was\u00a0nervously facing the prospect of having to leave\u00a0her partner behind in Australia after the Department of Immigration rejected her\u00a0partner visa application.", "A self-proclaimed\u00a0migration agent approached her\u00a0and promised to overturn the decision with their connections in the Department of Immigration.", "With limited English,\u00a0Linh, whose real identity is being kept anonymous for legal reasons,\u00a0had to rely on migration services to process her paperwork, since the resources for partner\u00a0visas were not available in Vietnamese.", "The so-called 'migration agent' asked Linh\u00a0to hand over her email account and passport as a requirement of the 'review process'.\u00a0", "\"The person speaks my language and seemed very experienced with similar cases so I thought I could trust him,\" Linh\u00a0said.", "\"He showed me pictures and screenshots of supposed government officials and they looked\u00a0very genuine.\"", "In desperation, Linh\u00a0complied with the request and gathered every cent from her savings account and borrowed money from family to give the 'agent' $110,000 in multiple transfers.\u00a0", "Linh's suspicions began when she was asked to provide more money and refused to pay. Finding herself locked out of her email account, Linh\u00a0decided to\u00a0report the case to police.", "\"I have had so many anxiety attacks that I had to seek psychiatric help.\"", "\"I go to work every day to pay back the money I still owe, feeling completely lost about what the future holds.\"", "The case is under police investigation.", "
Do connections make the visa application process easier?
", "", "
Migration agent Jack Ta says Australia is an attractive destination\u00a0for South and South-East Asian migrants.(ABC News: Tahlia Roy)
", "The Migration Institute of Australia's research fellow\u00a0Jack Ta says it is unlawful to claim that having connections can change the outcome of an immigration application.", "\"I don't believe connections within the Department of Immigration and the government move\u00a0anything differently or faster,\" Mr Ta told Afternoons Host Josh Szeps on ABC Radio Sydney.", "\"Connections are only an indication of how good an agent is at doing their job, from a reputation point of view.\"", "\"However, [being connected] is a ploy that many scammers often use.\"", "Mr Ta said\u00a0cases similar to\u00a0Linh's case are becoming increasingly common in Australia.\u00a0", "Data collected by the Home Affairs Department's migration fraud division before the COVID pandemic\u00a0showed that Australia received more than 500 reports of visa scams on average per year since 2014.", "
Why do people need migration agents?
", "Mr Ta, a migration consultant of more than\u00a020 years, says many of his clients rely on migration services to process their visa applications.", "\"All Australian visa application forms [including tourist visas] are only available in English, with the sole exception of the Chinese form for the tourist visa sub-class.\"\u00a0", "\"There are no official resources on Australian immigration in other languages except for the Settlement Information Sheet.\"\u00a0", "", "
Jack Ta says many migrants fall for visa scams because they are\u00a0desperate\u00a0to remain in Australia.(Supplied: Jack Ta)
", "Lawyer David Stephens, who has been giving legal advice on migration since 1996, says a lack of familiarity with the Australian legal system is one of the main reasons why migrants require professional help.", "\"Some people from legal jurisdictions overseas\u00a0without\u00a0a great document trail may find it extremely difficult to identify what visa to apply for and how to go about gathering documents.\"", "The Sydney-based migration agent says migrants from countries with bureaucratic corruption have challenges in understanding the Australian administrative process.\u00a0", "\"Some people have an attitude of you throw money at something and it is going to solve the problem, and obviously that doesn't work in Australia.\"", "
How do people fall for migration scams?
", "Mr Stephens says migrants are\u00a0vulnerable to scammers because they are in \"limbo\"\u00a0until they become permanent residents or citizens. He attributes most scams to non-registered agents.", "", "
Migration lawyer David Stephens says\u00a0immigration paperwork can be very complex.(Supplied: David Stephens)
", "\"Non-registered migration agents will promise anything and try to embezzle as much money and manipulate people as much as possible,\" Mr Stephens said", "\"People who con the migrants often prey on desperate cases where legitimate agents have turned down their clients due to the improbability of success.\"", "\"A registered agent or licensed lawyer has a code of conduct to abide by, and they are bound by law not to take on cases they deem to have little or no prospect of success.\"", "Mr Stephens says migration fraudsters and agents who over-promise and underdeliver have given his profession a bad name.", "\"Being registered doesn't necessarily protect a client entirely, because it doesn't guarantee the agent will do a good job and will not rip their clients off.\"", "
Fraud by visa\u00a0sponsors and applicants\u00a0
", "Mr Stephens says \"phoney agents\"\u00a0are not the only group to blame for migration fraud. He says \"fake sponsorship\"\u00a0is one of the most common ways to unlawfully exploit loopholes in immigration laws.", "", "
Migration agent David Stephens says Australia is one of the world's most desirable destinations for migrants.(ABC News: Melanie Vujkovic)
", "\"Some potential migrants\u00a0would pay certain companies, fake or real, to sponsor them for permanent residency.\"", "\"Allegedly, there have been cases of migrants paying Australian citizens to engage in fake marriages for visa sponsorship.\"", "Jack Ta says fraud by clients or their sponsors can be tricky to identify and become traps for inexperienced migration agents.", "\"When a client presents you with seemingly sound evidence and a strong case, should an agent reject it based on their gut feeling?\" Mr Ta said.", "\"It is a big grey area in our profession.\"", "
Tips from the experts
", "Here are tips from the experts on how to spot visa scams:"]
